title: Calendar; Decorated for the Holidays

body: QUICK! Where can you find a 1959 Girl Scout handbook, the first book in English about dogs or a Butterick sewing pattern from 1900? Try one of New York's hundreds of little specialized libraries, where materials like these abound but not a single book by Stephen King is in sight. Special libraries, as they are called, employ 1,400 librarians in the
title: MAKING IT WORK; Narrow Shelves, Depths of Knowledge

body: To the Editor: Councilman Water McCaffrey was succinct in ''A Plethora of 'Official' Cars Turns Area Into Parking Lot'' (Sept. 20). title: Sounding Off on Sex Clubs; Woe to Those Who Live Where City Workers Work

body: Oh, to Be Loud, Red and Shiny Many small children scream loudly, favor bright colors and race around like a house on fire. title: FAMILY FARE

title: Uphill Racers of New York City Politics; For a Variety of Reasons, Underdogs Persevere in the Face of Almost Sure Defeat

title: Providing Places to Work, Places to Live

body: A gunman on a bicycle rode up to a barbecue in Brooklyn early yesterday morning and opened fire, striking a 16-year-old who was apparently his intended target, but also shooting three other people who were attending a family reunion in a neighboring backyard, the police said. The shootings occurred just before 1 A.M. yesterday in the backyard of 1
title: Gunman Wounds 4 in Neighboring Yards

body: A Brooklyn man remained in critical condition last night after he was shot when he rode his bicycle into the middle of a gunfight on Saturday. title: METRO NEWS BRIEFS: NEW YORK; Brooklyn Man Is Charged In Shooting of Bicyclist

body: To the Editor: I was shocked to read about the callousness and cruelty with which Mayor Guiliani and the city treated the residents of 172 Stanton Street (''The Angry Urban Refugees,'' May 10). For a city that prides itself on its immigrant history, this is a flagrant slap in the face to this tradition, as the city's moves have deliberately and
title: Refugees, Musicians and Ferries; Displaced on Stanton St. Were Treated Callously

title: PLAYING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD

title: NEW YORKERS & CO.; For Espresso And Pastries

body: For weeks, Tatiana Cheeks fussed happily over her newborn baby, who gurgled and squirmed but never seemed to thrive. The little girl always seemed hungry, no matter how often she nursed. And when the child died in her sleep in March, relatives said, Ms. Cheeks wailed inconsolably, overwhelmed by the shock of losing her 6-week-old daughter. But
title: Baby Starves, And Mother Is Accused Of Homicide

title: Capital Case Has Jury of 12 After Queries On Attitudes

body: FOR CHILDREN Theater CIRQUE DU SOLEIL PRESENTS ''QUIDAM.'' title: SPARE TIMES

body: TWO years of unrelenting buyer demand has reduced the inventory of homes for sale throughout the New York metropolitan area. And in New York City, the ongoing demand for housing has so depleted the listings that multiple-bidding wars for newly
title: Buyers Finding Smaller Inventory of Homes for Sale

body: Exotic Eggs, Even of Emus Like many places this weekend, Prospect Park in Brooklyn will have an Easter bunny and Easter eggs. Short of Australia, however, it is probably the only one that will have an Easter wallaby and emu eggs, too. The wallaby, which will give out lollipops, will be the largest but by no means the only one of her species at the
title: FAMILY FARE

body: To the Editor: As a recent Brooklyn home buyer, I could appreciate ''For Middle Class, New York Shrinks as Home Prices Soar'' (front page, April 1). You do not mention, however, that while the middle class has been priced out of neighborhoods like Yorkville, the West Village and Brooklyn Heights, this is an excellent time to explore more racially
title: The Middle Class Can Live Here

title: PLAYING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD

body: In fits and starts over several decades, Park Slope has become a laboratory for both assimilation and gentrification. The Irish and the Italians once brawled on Fifth Avenue, followed by the Puerto Ricans, who elbowed into the mix. There were Jamaicans, and by the 1970's, the hippies had arrived, enticed by the lure of stately but inexpensive
title: Park Slope, Reshaped by Money; As Rents and Prices Rise, Some Fear for Neighborhood's Soul

body: A storm system that whipped up wicked weather across the nation cut a wet and windy swath through the metropolitan region yesterday, bringing 1.8 inches of rain to Central Park in 15 hours, toppling scaffolding with 50-mile-an-hour winds and flooding parts of Queens and New Jersey. In New York, where the rainfall eclipsed the 1.7 inches that fell
title: As March 9's Go, It Was the Soggiest Ever in New York

title: PLAYING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD

Sixteen of her pieces (a detail of one is shown above) can be seen at the Brooklyn Museum of Art in the show ''Scattered Petals,
title: PLAYING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD: PROSPECT HEIGHTS; Work That Elevates What's Found at the Feet

body: To the Editor: Without presenting the foundation of the teaching at Redeemer, you painted a picture accurate in some details but without truth. Redeemer teaches that through the grace of Jesus Christ, wounded people both good and bad are healed. In more than 500 sermons heard over seven and a half years, not once has Tim Keller or the other pastors
title: Redeemer Church Rejects The 'Hard-Line' Label

body: To the Editor: Re ''New York by the Hour'' (Dec. 7), I guess I'm from the old school of capitalism. As a child, I used to pride myself on returning from the state fair with my wallet intact; as a college student I swore never to possess a credit card, and as a New Yorker I enjoy going days without spending a penny. It's like fasting, only
title: A Day With No Spending Has Its Satisfactions

author: Mindy Aloff is a New York critic and magazine writer.
body: As anyone who has successfully weathered the application process at the Department of Motor Vehicles can vouch for, there are few things as satisfying as learning how to drive a car sufficiently well that a representative of the state is led to utter the two sweetest words in the D.M.V. vocabulary: ''You passed.'' As someone who has taken three
title: MY BROOKLYN; How Amazing, the Way I Learned to Drive
